_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



COMPANY OVERVIEW



Univar Solutions USA Inc. (hereafter Univar Solutions) is a wholesale chemical distributor serving a number of U.S. industries.  Univar Solutions supplies the food industry, chemical compounders, pharmaceuticals, mining, forest products, oil & gas producers, electronics, coatings and many other key industries with chemical raw materials required to produce or refine products used in numerous end-use markets.



Univar Solutions USA Inc. is a member of the National Association of Chemical Distributors (NACD) and complies with the Responsible Distribution Process (RDP), an environmental, health and safety improvement initiative.



Some products stored and handled by Univar Solutions are subject to EPA's Risk Management Program rule (40 CFR Part 68).  A key requirement of this rule is the preparation and submission of an RMP Plan, contained herein.  The contents of the RMP Plan are prescribed by EPA, including this Executive Summary.



CORPORATE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE APPROACH



1.  Prevention Program



Processes that are subject to OSHA'S Process Safety Management (PSM) standard and are regulated under EPA's RMP rule are subject to the Program 3 Prevention Program.  Univar Solutions has documented the Prevention Program in its Process Safety Management Manual and RMP Compliance Manual.  Briefly, these programs includes provisions and requirements for:



?    Process Safety Information

?    Process Hazards Analysis

?    Operating Procedures

?    Training

?    Mechanical Integrity

?    Management of Change

?    Incident Investigation

?    Employee Participation

?    Hot Work Permits

?    Contractors



2. Emergency Response Approach



Univar Solutions USA Inc. has an Emergency Contingency Plan in-place.  This plan is shared with local emergency responders who have access to our site and the Univar facility personnel.  Univar Solutions has an onsite technical support team that can respond to incidents.  We also have the capability to

call in outside professional emergency responders.



Univar Solutions invites and encourages local emergency responders such as the fire department and police department to visit and familiarize themselves with our products and facilities.  Joint emergency exercises are conducted when possible.



STATIONARY SOURCE



The Cincinnati Ohio site manufacturers, stores, handles, and delivers a variety of hazardous and non-hazardous chemical products to wholesale customers and municipalities in Ohio, Kentucky, Indiana, and West Virginia.  We have four substances at our facility in quantities above the RMP planning thresholds.  These substances include Chlorine, Sulfur Dioxide, Ammonia (anhydrous), ammonia water solutions, and cyclohexylamine.  The types of containers for these chemicals are:



?    Chlorine Transfer - railcars, 

?    Chlorine Storage -  railcars, 150# cylinders and ton containers,

?    Sulfur dioxide - 150# cylinders and ton containers,

?    Ammonia (anhydrous) storage tank and 150# cylinders,

?    Ammonia water solutions (>20%) - storage tanks, trucks, drums and intermediate bulk containers,

?    Cyclohexylamine - 55 gallon steel drums



GENERAL PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



As outlined previously, Univar Solutions USA Inc. is subject to OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation and utilizes this program to meet the prevention program requirements under RMP.



Chemical specific prevention steps include the following:

1.  The maintenance of minimal practical inventories.

2.  Employee training and operating procedures.

3.  Employee release detection and mitigation activities.

4.  Equipment and containers designed to meet appropriate regulatory guidelines.

5.  Chlorine and ammonia area detectors.



ACCIDENT HISTORY



The Cincinnati site has experienced one accident as specified in 40 CFR Part 68.42 related to the transfer or storage of chlorine in the previous 5 years.  During a July 2015 incident, an estimated 30 lbs. of chlo

rine were released from a ton container valve due to human error while degassing the returned ton container. 



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



The Univar Solutions Cincinnati site has a written Contingency Plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials.  The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas.  The site can utilize local emergency response contractors to provide onsite and offsite emergency response services in the event of a release.  The local West Chester Township Fire Department is familiar with and periodically visits the site.  Butler County is the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) with which our Contingency Plan has been coordinated.



REVISIONS



This RMP Plan was submitted as a correction on September 3, 2019. The reason for correction was to update the company name and email domain name in Section 1 and this Executive Summary from Univar USA Inc. to Univar Solutions USA Inc.  In late February 2019, Univar USA Inc. purchased the assets of Nexeo Solutions LLC.  Effective September 1, 2019, the assets of Nexeo Solutions LLC were transferred to Univar USA Inc. and the legal name of Univar USA Inc. changed to Univar Solutions USA Inc. There was no material change in the day-to-day operations and personnel overseeing compliance under the above referenced facility. The purchase of Nexeo Solutions LLC's assets and company name change do not constitute a transfer of ownership for the above referenced facility address.
